alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Alamance, northern Forsyth and northern Guilford Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Axton to Stoneville to near Dillard to near Hanging Rock State Park to Flat Rock. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, Kernersville, McLeansville, Summerfield, Stokesdale, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Haw River State Park and Lake Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
